statement.p: Explain how to find a basis in \Span\{v_1, \cdots , v_m\}.

Let v_1, \cdots , v_k be linearly independent vectors in \R^n . Describe an algorithm that finds a basis of \R^n containing v_1, \cdots , v_k. (Hint: form the matrix [v_1,\cdots,v_k,e_1,\cdots,e_n] and find pivotal columns. Why are the first k columns pivotal?)
If S is a subspace of \R^n what is the relationship between n and the dimension of S?
